question: Virtual memory allows a computer to use ________ as extra RAM when the actual RAM is full.
In ________, memory is divided into small fixed-size blocks called frames, and processes are divided into small fixed-size blocks called pages.
The process of swapping pages between RAM and the hard disk is known as ________.
One advantage of paging is that it avoids ________ fragmentation.
In segmentation, memory is divided into logical sections such as ________, data, and stack.
In segmentation, free memory may exist but may not be in a single ________ block, causing external fragmentation.
________ fragmentation occurs when a process is allocated more space than it needs, wasting memory within allocated blocks.
________ fragmentation occurs when free memory is scattered in small chunks, making it difficult to allocate a large block of memory.
A page fault occurs when a program requests data that is not in ________ but is stored in virtual memory.
A ________ page fault occurs when the required page is not in RAM and needs to be loaded from the disk.
A ________ page fault occurs when the page is available but not linked properly.
One way to reduce page faults is by increasing the ________ size.
One solution to external fragmentation in memory management is the technique of ________.
In paging, ________ solves external fragmentation by using fixed-size pages.
Paging is a technique that allows programs larger than ________ to run by swapping pages in and out of RAM.
The division of a program into logical sections, like code, data, and stack, is known as ________.
The key difference between paging and segmentation is that paging divides memory into ________ blocks, whereas segmentation divides it into logical sections.
One disadvantage of paging is that it can cause ________ fragmentation within allocated pages.
In virtual memory, when data is missing from RAM and needs to be fetched from the hard disk, it results in a ________ fault.
One way to optimize program execution and reduce page faults is by using efficient ________ algorithms.
